segment.source: Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) deployment requires a settings storage location where the user settings are stored in a settings package file.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) deployment requires a settings storage location where the user settings are stored in a settings package file.

segment.source: The settings storage location can be configured in one of the following two ways:
segment.target: The settings storage location can be configured in one of the following two ways:

segment.source: Active Directory home directory – if a home directory is defined for the user in Active Directory, the UE-V agent will use this location to store settings location packages.
segment.target: Active Directory home directory – if a home directory is defined for the user in Active Directory, the UE-V agent will use this location to store settings location packages.

segment.source: The UE-V agent dynamically creates the user-specific storage folder below the root of the home directory.
segment.target: The UE-V agent dynamically creates the user-specific storage folder below the root of the home directory.

segment.source: The agent only uses the home directory of the Active Directory if a settings storage location is not defined.
segment.target: The agent only uses the home directory of the Active Directory if a settings storage location is not defined.

segment.source: Create a settings storage share – the settings storage share is a standard network share that is accessible by UE-V users.
segment.target: Create a settings storage share – the settings storage share is a standard network share that is accessible by UE-V users.

segment.source: Deploy a UE-V settings storage share
segment.target: Deploy a UE-V settings storage share

segment.source: When you create the settings storage share, you should limit access only to users that need access.
segment.target: When you create the settings storage share, you should limit access only to users that need access.

segment.source: The necessary permissions are shown in the tables below.
segment.target: The necessary permissions are shown in the tables below.

segment.source: To deploy the UE-V network share
segment.target: To deploy the UE-V network share

segment.source: Create a new security group for UE-V users.
segment.target: Create a new security group for UE-V users.

segment.source: Create a new folder on the centrally located computer that will store the UE-V settings packages, and then grant the UE-V users with group permissions to the folder.
segment.target: Create a new folder on the centrally located computer that will store the UE-V settings packages, and then grant the UE-V users with group permissions to the folder.

segment.source: The administrator supporting UE-V will need permissions to this shared folder.
segment.target: The administrator supporting UE-V will need permissions to this shared folder.

segment.source: Set the following share-level (SMB) permissions for the setting storage location folder:
segment.target: Set the following share-level (SMB) permissions for the setting storage location folder:

segment.source: User account
segment.target: User account

segment.source: Recommended permissions
segment.target: Recommended permissions

segment.source: Everyone
segment.target: Everyone

segment.source: No Permissions
segment.target: No Permissions

segment.source: Security group of UE-V users
segment.target: Security group of UE-V users

segment.source: Full Control
segment.target: Full Control

segment.source: Set the following NTFS permissions for the settings storage location folder:
segment.target: Set the following NTFS permissions for the settings storage location folder:

segment.source: User account
segment.target: User account

segment.source: Recommended permissions
segment.target: Recommended permissions

segment.source: Folder
segment.target: Folder

segment.source: Creator/Owner
segment.target: Creator/Owner

segment.source: Full Control
segment.target: Full Control

segment.source: Subfolders and Files Only
segment.target: Subfolders and Files Only

segment.source: Security group of UE-V users
segment.target: Security group of UE-V users

segment.source: List Folder/Read Data, Create Folders/Append Data
segment.target: List Folder/Read Data, Create Folders/Append Data

segment.source: This Folder Only
segment.target: This Folder Only

segment.source: Click OK to close the dialog boxes.
segment.target: Click OK to close the dialog boxes.

segment.source: This permission configuration allows users to create folders for settings storage.
segment.target: This permission configuration allows users to create folders for settings storage.

segment.source: The UE-V agent creates and secures a folder while running in the context of the user.
segment.target: The UE-V agent creates and secures a folder while running in the context of the user.

segment.source: The user receives full control to their folder.
segment.target: The user receives full control to their folder.

segment.source: Other users do not inherit access to this folder.
segment.target: Other users do not inherit access to this folder.

segment.source: You do not need to create and secure individual user directories, because this will be done automatically by the agent that runs in the context of the user.
segment.target: You do not need to create and secure individual user directories, because this will be done automatically by the agent that runs in the context of the user.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Additional security can be configured when a Windows server is utilized for the settings storage share.
segment.target: Additional security can be configured when a Windows server is utilized for the settings storage share.

segment.source: UE-V can be configured to verify that either the local administrator's group or the current user is the owner of the folder where settings packages are stored.
segment.target: UE-V can be configured to verify that either the local administrator's group or the current user is the owner of the folder where settings packages are stored.

segment.source: To enable additional security complete the following:
segment.target: To enable additional security complete the following:

segment.source: Add a REGDWORD registry key named "RepositoryOwnerCheckEnabled" to HKEYLOCALMACHINESoftwareMicrosoftUEVAgentConfiguration.
segment.target: Add a REGDWORD registry key named "RepositoryOwnerCheckEnabled" to HKEYLOCALMACHINESoftwareMicrosoftUEVAgentConfiguration.

segment.source: Set registry key value to 1.
segment.target: Set registry key value to 1.
